results.title: White Christmas
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Robert Emmett Dolan and Michael Curtiz
results.brief_description: White Christmas is a treasury of Irving Berlin classics, among them “Count Your Blessings Instead of Sheep”, “Sisters”, “Blue Skies”, and the beloved holiday song “White Christmas”. Two talented song-and-dance men (Bing Crosby and Danny Kaye) team up after the war. One winter they join forces with a sister act (Rosemary Clooney and Vera-Ellen) and trek to Vermont for a white Christmas. The result is “the stuff dreams are made of”.

results.title: Whistle down the wind
results.creator_credit: Beaver Films, Richard Attenborough and Bryan Forbes
results.brief_description: Based on Mary Hayley Bell’s popular novel, this is a charming and thoughtful study of the fragile nature of childhood trusts and beliefs. Hayley Mills and Alan Bates give excellent performances in this story of three innocent children who find a fugitive from the law in their barn and believe that he is Jesus. Produced by award-winning Richard Attenborough, this film is a poignant unveiling of the children’s gradual understanding of the truth, which will delight adults and children alike.

results.title: While you were sleeping
results.creator_credit: Hollywood Pictures, Joe Roth, Roger Birnbaum and Jon Turteltaub
results.brief_description: Lucy (Sandra Bullock), a young subway ticket collector spends her days fantasising about one of her regular commuters, Peter (Peter Gallagher). One day fate intervenes when Lucy witnesses Peter being mugged at the station and tossed on to the tracks. Saving him from near death, Lucy gets Peter to hospital where through a misunderstanding his family assume that Lucy is Peter’s fiancee. However the plot takes a further turn when Lucy finds herself attracted to Peter’s brother Jack (Bill Pullman). A charming romantic screwball comedy. Cast also includes Peter Boyle, Glynis Johns, Micole Mercurio, Jack Warden.

details.label: Subject categories

results.title: When we were kings [DVD]
results.creator_credit: DAS Films, Taylor Hackford, Leon Gast and David Sonenberg
results.brief_description: The heavyweight title fight between Muhammad Ali and George Foreman in Kinshasa (Zaire) on 30 October 1974 - `The Rumble in the Jungle’ - is enshrined as one of the great sports events of the century. It was also a cultural and political happening. Utilizing original footage of the fight, the film is on one level a lost documentary revealing never-before-seen images of the Fight of the Century between a then relatively unpopular, but fearsome, boxer named George Foreman and his nearly mythical antagonist, the incomparable Muhammad Ali. Filmmakers Gast and Hackford also construct a riveting story of the drama and significance of an event which signified the beginning of a new age of black culture and identity. Complete with performances by B.B. King, James Brown, and Miriam Makeba, marked by the launching of the career of notorious promoter Don King, and overshadowed by the ominous presence of Zaire’s President Mobutu, this is a discourse on what it meant to be black in America in that tumultuous time. Not only does the film deal with issues of segregation and integration and the emergence of black pride and black consciousness, but most critically, it describes the return to Africa of black American visitors. At the centre of the film is Ali, who, both as athlete and entertainer, persona and man, is a compelling figure, deeply committed to issues of racial, religious and political justice. The film also features insights and commentary from Norman Mailer, George Plimpton, and Spike Lee.

results.title: When night is falling
results.creator_credit: Crucial Pictures, Alliance Communications, Barbara Tranter and Patricia Rozema
results.brief_description: Camille, a professor of mythology at the Christian New College of Faith, and her boyfriend Martin are being pressured to marry by the principal of the college. When her dog dies Camille finds comfort with Petra, a sexy circus performer, who she meets at a laundry. As their friendship gradually develops into a love affair Camille’s life is turned upside down and she realises she must make a choice between a secure life with her fiance, or one of adventure, passion and uncertainty with Petra. Sumptuously filmed in lush colours, Rozema draws on the magic and drama of daring circus acts to symbolically convey Camille’s struggle to set herself free. Cast includes Pascale Bussieres, Rachael Crawford, Henry Czerny and Don McKellar Winner of Audience Award, Berlin Film Festival 1995.

results.title: When Harry met Sally...
results.creator_credit: Castle Rock Entertainment, Rob Reiner and Andrew Scheinman
results.brief_description: Infamous for it’s restaurant scene that provokes the, “I’ll have what she’s having” line, this romantic comedy written by Nora Ephron follows the slowly developing relationship between Harry Burns (Billy Crystal) and Sally Albright (Meg Ryan). Harry and Sally meet in the 1970’s when they share a car trip courtesy of a mutual friend. They never run out of things to say, and Harry sticks by his proclamation that men cannot be friends with attractive women. Over the course of the next 10 years, both of them fall in and out of love, grow closer as friends, and contemplate a romantic future together when they cross the boundary between friends and lovers in a moment of emotional weakness. This film provided played a pivotal role in the renaissance of modern romantic comedy, led by Nora Ephron who went on to be involved in films such as “Sleepless in Seattle” and “You’ve got mail”, both of which featured Meg Ryan in the romantic lead. Cast also includes Carrie Fisher and Bruno Kirby.

results.title: When a man loves a woman
results.creator_credit: Luis Mandoki, Touchstone Pictures, Jordan Kerner and Jon Avnet
results.brief_description: Family and marriage are put under threat when Alice’s (Meg Ryan) drinking becomes an addiction. Husband Michael (Andy Garcia), an airline pilot, is a perfectionist and finds it increasingly difficult to control his often reckless and neglectful wife. It takes an accident before Alice realises she has hit rock bottom and needs help. After attending a rehab clinic Alice finally returns home stronger, more independent and alcohol free but Michael, on the other hand, has problems adjusting to the new Alice. He prefers the needy and dependent wife. As the marriage begins to break down, Michael and Alice take the long and difficult road to recovery through counselling. Cast also includes Lauren Tom, Philip Seymour Hoffman, Tina Majorino, Mae Whitman, Ellen Burstyn.

results.title: What women want [DVD]
results.creator_credit: ICON, Paramount Pictures, Wind Dancer Productions, Centropolis Effects, Susan Cartonis, Bruce Davey, Gina Matthews, Nancy Meyers and Matt Williams
results.brief_description: Nick Marshall (Mel Gibson) is a real ladies man. Raised by his mother, a Las Vegas showgirl, he has a somewhat distorted perception of what women really want, and an enormous ego. When he is passed over for an executive position in the advertising agency for a woman his chauvinistic attitude worsens. A freak accident while trying to brainstorm ideas for a new advertising campaign, leaves Nick with the ability to hear what women think. Amazed by his new talent Nick seeks the help of a therapist (Bette Midler) who suggests he think of it as a gift and not a curse, and to use this to his advantage. Nick sets his sights on Darcy McGuire (Helen Hunt), the new creative director in the agency. At first his plan works, and he undermines Darcy at every opportunity, until he realises Darcy has feelings for him, and that he feels the same way about her. Cast also includes Marisa Tomei, Mark Feurstein, Lauren Holly, Valerie Perrine, Delta Bourke and Alan Alda.

results.title: What have I done to deserve this? = Que he hecho yo para merecer esto?
results.creator_credit: Tesauro S A, Kaktus S A, Tadeo Villabla and Pedro Almodovar
results.brief_description: Gloria is a housewife with attitude. She has to be: one son is a drug dealer, her youngest son is having an affair with the family dentist, her husband can’t excite her anymore, and her mother-in-law is determined to drive her crazy. To survive in the concrete jungle of Madrid, Gloria snorts cleaning powders and searches for sex with masculine strangers. This wickedly funny movie is an early feature by Almodovar and it revels in inverting and satirising the conventions of television soap opera and of the Hollywood “women’s film”. Absurd, fast-paced and stylistically innovative, “What Have I Done to Deserve This?” stars the fabulous Carmen Maura.
